{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3551809,"name":"graywhaler","username":"graywhaler","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T12:52:01.798Z","cooked":"

Hello,
We are seeing strange behavior with Limelight 3A connected to our bot. We have 2 cameras connected through a powered USB hub. Each works perfectly independently, but only one appears in glass or feeds data to the network table at a time. Which one it is appears to be random… they switch after a power cycle of the bot. We’ve checked the configuration and the NT network is set to 0.0.0.0. Any ideas out there?

graywhaler:

NT network is set to 0.0.0.0.

Not a programmer so I’m not sure, but I feel like this is the root cause as it can’t differentiate between the two?

My limited understanding of LL3A is you can only use one. You can use it alongside other LL…but for some reason you can only use one 3A. Of course, that is with the REV Control Hub. I am not sure about the Pi group…

Limelight Vision

Limelight 3A

Limelight levels the playing field by making reliable vision processing accessible no matter your experience level!

Price: USD 189.00
